intro: Javieria rhopalorrhachis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed sea rocket, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of southern California and Baja California. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and pinnately divided leaves. The plant thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in maritime environments. It produces small, elongated pods that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Javieria rhopalorrhachis is a hardy, salt-tolerant species that plays a role in stabilizing coastal dunes.
